website_summaries.verdict: Sony's WH-1000XM3 headphones feature some of the best audio performance we've heard paired from a pair that also boasts excellent noise cancellation.
pros: Excellent audio performance with superb bass depth and high-frequency clarity
App includes adjustable EQ and ANC controls

customer_reviews.title: dealbreakingly bad telephone calls
customer_reviews.text: The sound is wonderful, the noise cancelling magical, the headphones comfortable. So why one star? Because the quality of the microphone and / the digital processing of the voice makes them unusable for phone calls. And if they are unusable for phone calls, then they are unusable period. When a phone call came in, i had to plug in my £6.99 wired generic headphones to have a conversation. After paying £329... ridiculous. Sent back for a refund. Sad really, Sony achieved the hard challenge (sound quality & NC) but failed on the easy part. (Simple phone conversation)
customer_reviews.author: Mr interesting

customer_reviews.title: Creaky Plastic
customer_reviews.text: Sound Quality and noise cancellation is great but the creaking plastic kills the experience. It creaks when you put them on and creaks moving your head or face. When they are on the creaky plastic sound is really loud going through your head. Make the entire experience feel cheap. in comparison the Bose Quiet Comfort II feel so much more premium and solid.
customer_reviews.author: GarethL

customer_reviews.title: Microphone cannot be used for calling apps on phones or computers
customer_reviews.text: The title says it all unfortunately. The Good: Received the headphones recently and the audio quality is generally good, the companion app features work including adjusting noise cancellation to your environment. Battery life has been great. The Ugly (and dealbreaker for an expensive headset) : On the use of calling apps for smartphones and computers This unit supports normal incoming calls only. Calling apps for smartphones and computers are not supported
customer_reviews.author: John Parker

customer_reviews.title: Showdown
customer_reviews.text: I'll spare the details as you've probably researched these to death already. Ultimately most people will want to know whether these are better than the Bose Qc35's or not. In my opinion, the answer is unequivocally "Yes!". The Bose are beaten in terms of sound quality, noise cancelling, build quality, features, accompanying app and looks. The Bose may be a tad more comfy (really marginally) with a little more room in the ear cup and a little less imposing on you skull but that's all they have going for them over the Sony's. Oh, well I guess I'll give them the edge for the carry case too. Winner = Sony!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Very unimpressive for the cost. Not significantly better at noise cancelling than models a tenth the price. Kept shutting itself down for no reason. I sent it back.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as I expected
customer_reviews.text: Connection problems, will not reconnect to last connected device, have to manually manage. Too much bass emphasis, lacking in treble detail and the earphone leather squeaks and creaks..!! Noise cancellation is excellent but not useful enough to warrant living with the aforementioned problems.
customer_reviews.author: John Ward

customer_reviews.title: One Improvement Not Mentioned
customer_reviews.text: This is not a full review as there are far some very good reviews already here. I agree with all the good stuff. One improvement over the MX2s is that reporting the battery life now gives an approximate percentage left so, instead of; Battery level: Medium The MX3s will say: Battery level: about 80% I find this a lot more useful.
customer_reviews.author: SempaiX

customer_reviews.title: Has big flaws in design which warranty doesn't cover for
customer_reviews.text: I owned these headphones for 6 months, never dropped them, carried them in the case, and always were trying to take good care of it. One time while taking those off a tiny plastic broke off which holds some kind of lid (I have no idea why it even is there, access battery?), and now my headphones are unusable, when I put them on, the lid opens up and the headphones starts falling apart. I will probably have to glue the thing and put some duct tape around £300 headphones so I could use them again. Because the sony replied the warranty doesn't cover that kind of damage.
customer_reviews.author: RV

customer_reviews.title: Wont charge!
customer_reviews.text: Out the box - followed the documented charging regime, no charge. Searched online and discovered this is a common fault which has been reported for many months from many purchasers. Not going to waste my time grumbling and troubleshooting, these are going straight back for a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Hot Tub Time Machine

customer_reviews.title: Surprising improvement
customer_reviews.text: Compared to the previous version the XM2; -They are noticeable lighter -Less tight on the head -Much better power and NC buttons - they are no longer as flush so easier to find -Good volume level, sound. Yes they're bassy. -Texture of the right cup for controls feels much nicer. Unexpected. Easier to swipe -All cables contained in redesigned inner pouch. -Usb c great -Bass make them rumble! -Nicer box which is easily to open Negatives; -the price -the supplied USB c cable is very short
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous51

customer_reviews.title: Far too difficult to set up
customer_reviews.text: No doubt these headphones would be great if you could work out how to set them up. I installed the app and spent three hours trying to get them to work. Gave up! Couldn’t get them to connect or work at all. Far too complicated. Returned them for refund.
customer_reviews.author: Bubbs

customer_reviews.title: Expensive but really worth it
customer_reviews.text: Bought them to block out the noise in the office (eg printer noise, conversations) for better focus. They are great, I wear them daily with no issues. ✅EXTREMELY comfortable on your head ✅you get what you pay for: expensive but top quality customised settings, etc ✅super long battery life & quick to charge ✅fantastic (and I really mean it!) quality of sound, I am very impressed ✅come in a nice travel case ❌could block out more noise, but definitely do block out most of it I hope that this review was of help to you :-)
customer_reviews.author: Ally M

customer_reviews.title: Good noise cancelling horrible sound quality
customer_reviews.text: The sound quality isn’t the greatest sounds pretty bad actually but the noise cancelling does work though and superbly
customer_reviews.author: Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Incredible comfort, sound and noise cancelling
customer_reviews.text: Just buy them I’m hugely into my Music and have spent a lot of time trying out different Headphones Tried the Bose Tried the Sennheiser Tried the Beats (just because of the hype) Tried the Bowers & Wilkins I hadn’t considered these until I was recommended trying them....... They are a different league to anything else, I mean Sony knocked this one out of the park! We have two sets now as my wife kept stealing mine for trips instead of taking her own. You will not regret buying these headphones Incredibly comfortable even for long durations. Great sound cancelling (I mean great as well), screaming baby on a flight? Nooooo problemo, pop these on and its silent night.
customer_reviews.author: Scorp77

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these headphones mainly because of the highly praised noise cancellation technology. However, soon after receiving them I noticed that when noise cancellation is active there is a constant hissing noise coming from the left earphone. This happens every time noise cancellation is activate, and grows louder and more pronounced the longer I wear the headphones. The right side is fine. I've tried the noise cancelling optimiser in the app a number of times but there's no improvement. This issue is extremely annoying and frankly unacceptable for a pair of brand new headphones that cost me £265. The noise cancellation experience is ruined. Therefore I am returning the headphones after 2 days.
customer_reviews.author: Hamish

customer_reviews.title: Great (But its all about expectations)
customer_reviews.text: This product is full of quality, when it comes to sound, build, packaging, & looks. The ambient control feature is quite usefull if you want certain ammount of sound to pass. Noise cancelling mode is quite good especially once you get used to it. The reason i said, its all about expectiations, becaue when NC is on and no music is playing, the noise coming through is massively reduced, but i have seen people expecting nothing should come through, and that is not the case. Its a limitation of current technology across all similar product.
customer_reviews.author: Raed AbuSanad

customer_reviews.title: Not for me at all! Very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I had really high hopes for these. I debated with myself for months before finally reading another article on how amazing these headphones were, and decided to buy them. CONS: I live in London and get underground everyday for work. These make my ears sweat like crazy. The noise cancelling/ tightness of the ear cups make my ears pop when I turn them on Ambient sound is totally useless.. it’s continuously changes, meaning your music is stopped / paused No way near as comfortable as the Bose QC 35s Sound was good, but not £300 good. I’d avoid unfortunately. These are being returned ASAP.
customer_reviews.author: Antony

customer_reviews.title: After 10 pairs of headphones search is over.
customer_reviews.text: OMG! I have no words to describe how perfect this headphones are! I have used them in office, on the flight and on the street. Works 100%. Highly recommended for Xmax presents lol. Search is over! I had Sennheiser HD660S, Bose Quiet Comfort 3 and many more and none of them works as I wanted it to works. Worth every penny and I am buying 2nd pair for my wife. If you finding this review helpful, please click helpful button below and follow me for more reviews. Thank you
customer_reviews.author: MegaSeb

customer_reviews.title: Premium headphones using CHEAP plastic
customer_reviews.text: I bought these headphones about 3 months ago, and they have been amazing. The sound quality is superb, they are so lightweight and comfortable you don't even feel like you're wearing them and the noise cancelled is second to none. However, despite treating these with the utmost care the plastic on the headphones has started cracking. Not at all what I would expect from a pair of premium headphones. I'm really dissapointed because from some research it seems like this is a systemic issue with the WH-1000XM3's due to the poor quality materials used in they're construction.
customer_reviews.author: James Kant

customer_reviews.title: Appalling manufacture design defect with noise cancelling
customer_reviews.text: The xm3 is better than the xm2 with clearer sound, comfortable and good battery life. However the noise cancelling has a strong hiss which is louder than the older model. Also on TWO headsets now one of the ear-cups develops an imbalance in the hiss which is disconcerting. Then after a bit more time you get a variation in his strength and popping. According to the SONY customer representative, this is due to thermal noise issues. I looks on the forums and this is a common defect. They ask yo to send it back to the SONY repair center, bin it and send you a new boxed headset. If you are unlucky, the replacement has exactly the same problem.
customer_reviews.author: Array

customer_reviews.title: Incredible!
customer_reviews.text: These are the nuts! Honestly amazing. Sound is superb and its great that I now have an excuse not to hear my boyfriend speaking. But seriously, on the noise cancelling mode you really can't hear anything, but you can also adjust the settings (all by a click of a button) to ensure that you can hear background noise such as traffic etc. Quick charge and brilliant app you can download to control how you want them to work. I feel like I am sat in a concert. An ad came on the other day (helicopter noise) and it freaked me out as I genuinely thought there was a helicopter coming towards me haha. So yes, top marks.
customer_reviews.author: docgirl

customer_reviews.title: Ideal For Music Lovers.
customer_reviews.text: Dispite the great reviews I had to return them after a week as I found them hard to manage using the app on my iPhone, which just got too much for me. Another point that made them unsuitable was they only worked wirelessly listening to music, but watching a movie on my TV I had to connect them by cable. As I bought them for movie watching I had to return them as unsuitable as I would prefer not to use wireless headphones with a cable attached.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: What can I say about these headphones. They are absolutely fantastic. They definitely sound like a €300 set. Sound is crystal clear once you turn the bass down a bit in EQ. ANC is top class. Very little of that cabin pressure feeling you get with cheaper noise cancelling headphones. Another reviewer said the volume was low. Absolute nonsense. I use them at just over half my phone's volume and they are plenty loud. Can recommended them 100%. Well done Sony.
customer_reviews.author: Grahamer72

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant noise-cancelling, long-lasting battery-/Stopped working after 8 months
customer_reviews.text: I tried many headphones - the Sony 1000XM3 were by far the best, and better than my original choice, the latest Bose ones. Sound quality is decent and the battery goes on and on and on. I wouldn't recommend these for home use where you don't need noise cancellation - you can get better sound quality with many other headphones (see B&O Play for the best sound quality and decent noise cancellation). But for travellers, including those who go on long flights, these Sony headphones are by far the best. Added later: Stopped working after 8 months - sound totally garbled. Sent for repairs but although sound is louder now, it is still completely garbled, like listening to something underwater.
customer_reviews.author: M-Rev

customer_reviews.title: Started well but we have issues..
customer_reviews.text: Got these and WOW, noise cancelling amazing, sound very good indeed altho i feel the bass is a tad weak but still very good. BUT, recently after just 2 months the right ear cup has started hissing while in noise cancelling mode and intermittently it crackels and pops. Apparently this is a well know issue that i have found on sony forums. I have contacted sony support and will update. I may be unlucky but a tad miffed at the "premium" headphones have failed already. 😤 also even in very and i mean very light wind, you hear the wind through the earcups. Update: sony worse than useless. Returned to amazon for full refund.
customer_reviews.author: Jonlugz

customer_reviews.title: Hissing
customer_reviews.text: These are great headphones the noise cancelling is great. You can optimise the noise cancelling to your environment with the app. It cuts out the noise. I have not worn them outside but generally around the house. The noise of the washing machine is just a hmmmmm. Noisy neighbors don’t really hear them. But the sounds leaks out like crazy. Also there is terrible hiss in the left ear when you have the noise cancelling on. You buy these headphones for quiet. Not for a permanent hiss. It’s a common problem. So therefore I decided to return them and get the rival the Bose comfort ii.
customer_reviews.author: me

customer_reviews.title: Quite remarkable!
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are quite remarkable! The noise cancelling technology is very impressive; far superior to anything else that I have heard. The sound quality is amazing - sounds better than the very expensive (and now redundant) wired headphones that I used to use with my Sony Xperia phone. They are lightweight and fold up nicely in their case. They look great and the build quality, finish and battery life are all excellent.
customer_reviews.author: gdspeed

customer_reviews.title: Unmatched sound
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are very accurate and very isolated. Their noise cancellation and isolation blows Bose out of the water. Their clear, crisp, yet still punchy bass are a far cry from the muddy mess that the 35 QuietComfort II produced. The Bose noise cancelling was reasonable, but nowhere near the quality of these. The only reason I can't give a 5 star is a terrible hissing in my right headphone, that only got worse with further listening after resetting after disuse. My first pair were returned afterwards, my second aren't exhibiting this behaviour yet. If you want more bass, the EQ controls give you punch without sacrificing any other tone range. You will not regret these convenient headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Rubbish
customer_reviews.text: The pairing is pants. The app is rubbish and misleads. The software update sticks at 10%. The iPhone says it’s connected via Bluetooth but the music won’t play when it had done earlier. The inconsistency is the problem - it is hard to problem solve when it works one minute then not the next. They’ve tried to inject too many features - all you want is headphones and simple controls. Wretched wretched earphones. I’m going to give Bose a go
customer_reviews.author: blueskychris

customer_reviews.title: Great quality NC, but limited to one device at a time
customer_reviews.text: This product is great from a point of view of its noise cancelling functionality, they work a dream on the train or in a busy office. However i marked it down because of 3 factors, 1. the sweatiness caused by the ear pads 2. the fit of the headband is a bit big and cannot be reduced anymore, they gradually slip forward so couldn't wear them running for example. 3. my biggest disappointment, I the fact they can only be connected to one device at a time. I had wanted to be able to answer a mobile call with them and for eg a Skype call on my computer but they will only connect to one device at a time.
customer_reviews.author: Grace

customer_reviews.title: Amazing NC, plus so many added features make this the industry leading model to buy.
customer_reviews.text: These noise cancelling headphones (Sony WH-1000X M3) are the very best money can buy. They’re truly magical in the way they neutralise and fend off outside noises. I tested it by blasting the tv on loudly during an episode of Top Gear, Jeremy Clarkson’s voice was rendered wonderfully silent. I then tested these against regular at home noises and whilst I could see my wife’s mouth moving, I heard not a word. Next up, the true test, my son screaming at the top of his voice...barely audible. Wearing these headphones is like being cocooned in a comfy bubble wrap of auditory heaven. 10/10.
customer_reviews.author: T. Watt

customer_reviews.title: Unmusical and disappointing sound. Great NC. Not for me.
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are way too expensive for the audio quality delivered. They're muddy in the mid-bass and very far from neutral. The standard eq unaltered is unmusical and unappealing. The noise cancelling is however amazingly good. I struggled to "want" the audio delivered and countered with app EQ but ultimately they had to go back. What a shame Sony didn't attend to the basics. Even the app they created for the headphones only has simple non parametric 5 band eq. Not a priority for them it seems...
customer_reviews.author: Soul Fan

customer_reviews.title: Best noise cancellation as of 2019
customer_reviews.text: This is the top of the line noise cancellation technology as of 2019. Compared to the Bose QC35 - there is no comparison, this is way better on the plane, on the bus and on motorways. Wished I had bought this much earlier. Let’s you turn off the outside world. Sound quality is excellent with good bass response. Comfort level wise wore it for a 16 hour flight and it was fine. Keeps the ears warm in winter as well.
customer_reviews.author: agtshm

customer_reviews.title: Started with a static noise from NC problem. Seems to have fixed itself
customer_reviews.text: Have tried two pairs now. Both have the same issue with NC mode. Okay for about an hour, but the right ear gives lots of static in it after that. So the noise cancelling just works in 1 ear. Annoyingly worse than my 1000xm2s. If you're after NC Sony failed with these. Not recommended. Update: moved from 1 star to 4 star. These headphones like the 1000xm2 before are great headphones I use for very long time periods. Feel a bit plasticy and creak a little bit, but NC is great, comfortable, sound quality good (I'm not an audiophile though). Just 4 stars, but if they had better quality control I give them 5.
customer_reviews.author: iostream

customer_reviews.title: Best headphones I've ever owned for listening to music
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are fantastic! I've had many in the past (including Bose) but none that are as comfortable as these for long listening sessions (especially since I wear glasses) and none that sounded this good! If you need convincing, simply find somebody who'll let you try them - you'll be convinced very quickly! For me, the only downside was the ridiculously short charging cable (less than 10cm!) which I promptly managed to lose! However, since the charger is one of the more obscure USB fittings, it took a while for me to find an alternative cable. If you purchase these, do yourself a favour and get a spare charger BEFORE you lose the silly little cable the comes supplied.
customer_reviews.author: John Landells

customer_reviews.title: Almost as good as the Bose QCs
customer_reviews.text: Great headphones but the Bose QC have the edge on sound quality (IMO) and are much comfier. Noise cancelling seems identical. I did a direct comparison with both these at home and in the end the Bose was clearly the winner. I haven't tried the Bose 700s but prefer the look and feel of the QCs. The Sonys are heavier and chunkier and somehow also allow less room for your ears than the Bose. I wouldn't want to wear them for a long haul whereas I have with the Bose and didn't want to take them off.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: The best ANC headphones out here right now (vs Microsoft / Bose)
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Design (In my opinion on par or better with Bose, but they definitely beat the look of the surface headphones by Microsoft). Comfort - Improved headband and ear cushions (compared against 2nd gen version) Breathability - In summer, they are less likely to make your ears sweat due to the new ear padding Charging - USB-C charging and also quick charge. Gesture control - Added features that make this really good Voice assistant button - Google / Alexa / Siri (kinda) Cons: Price Design, some may or may not like it The gesture controls can take some time to get used to it Comfort, some do say that the bose are better.
customer_reviews.author: William S-S

customer_reviews.title: Life-changing headphones
customer_reviews.text: Bought these to wear at work to cut out all the constant work BS babble as well as HVAC/Computer noise. Stunning noise cancellation, whisper quiet when wearing these. Superb audio quality over both wired and BT connection, the latter offering touch-swipe control of volume / track sequencing. Wish I'd bought these years ago, great to be able to choose between a silent ambient space or listen to my favourite head sounds. Not cheap by any means, but if they last a few years then worth every penny for peace and quiet.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy Bose 700s Buy these!
customer_reviews.text: Bought the Bose 700s first. After a firmware update the noise cancellation stopped and the sound quality was poor. I bought these as a replacement and love them. Noise cancellation spot on. Very comfortable to wear. Works well on calls. And most importantly AMAZING sound quality. Ther headphone made the Bose 700s sound like cheap imported cans. To sum up. If you are undecided as I was between Bose and Sony. Go for these beauties!
customer_reviews.author: BrilliantBri

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant NC headphones
customer_reviews.text: These Sony NC headphones are the best purchase i have made from amazon, And although it doesn't completely stop out side noise from entering when you are listening to music etc. The sound and the bass are quite something else. I cannot recommend these headphones highly enough. And with black Friday & cyber Monday coming up look out for these if you are after a pair of NC headphones. Top marks to Sony for producing what i would class as the best pair of NC headphone in the market today. highly recommend them. 5*
customer_reviews.author: Mr Bazson56

customer_reviews.title: Great headphones if a little on the pricey side
customer_reviews.text: I use these for frequent travel and in the office. They work really well, in use for about 3 months now and haven't had any issues with them. Ear sups can get a little hot against the skin after a lot of use and the noise cancelling is very good but it isn't all noise of course. Great on a plane but the plug in lead tends to be on the wrong side of the headphones for me, not a big issue as mainly use with Bluetooth which has great performance. If you want a goof quality pair of noise canceling headphones I would recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Sore and hot ears, not deep enough, poor design. Great ANC
customer_reviews.text: Great sound But not at all comfortable on ears for long. Pads very soft and collapse to nothing when worn. Therefore pressure on back of ear (the antihelix). Sore after 20min. Terrible for the £ Also ears get very warm after a short use so that's another strike against the design. ANC works great. Bought to take some of the noise misery out of traveling on the Central Line on the tube. Great for that. Pity about poor design around physical comfort. Now looking for an alternative compatible pad to make the product bearable to wear. Suggestions welcome
customer_reviews.author: Lon

customer_reviews.title: Truly amazing for what it is with a common flaw
customer_reviews.text: As far as noise cancelling headphones go along with immersive sound production and balance. these are in my opinion the best. They outclass the Bose QC35 II as what i felt was the best i had at the time. Build quality is great and the pads are probably memory foam? they slowly return to their original shape after removing them and can be worn for hours without discomfort. My only issue is along with many others, the sides of the headphones almost instantly start creaking and that is to be honest, quite embarrasing when you look atr the premium price of it.
customer_reviews.author: Mo

customer_reviews.title: Best earphones I've used
customer_reviews.text: Love them. use them for travelling. Cancel those annoying screams and shouts from little ninjas in the airplanes, coffee shops, etc. Use them in the underground and at work. Sometime i just use them without music just to zone out if I have to be focused on something. I could write technical details but its on the product specifications. The only down side I would say is the ear getting a bit hot if you wear them for long period of times. But I would say is expected from an over-the-ear headphone. Obviously I would not recommend them for running or expecting to be sweat proof...
customer_reviews.author: Fabian

customer_reviews.title: Better to look for other options
customer_reviews.text: When I first purchased this item I was so excited and impressed with the sound quality. Unfortuantely in a couple of months the strap broke, it turned out the material used is really cheap. Also if you are planning to use this headphones with your phone and use it's mic for phone calls etc. DO NOT. It is terrible for that and believe me you'll end up carrying a second set of headphones just for phone conversations. My previous headphones were Bose and I really regret changing the brand.
customer_reviews.author: Burak Uytun

customer_reviews.title: The best headphones I've ever used; a real competator to the Bose QC35
customer_reviews.text: Comfort One of the most comfortable headphone on the market; I've sat through a 13 hour flight with these the whole way with no issues. Sound Sound quality is second none, I'm no audiophile, but you do start to notice the quality when you go back to your old headphones/ earphones. Work They are now my daily drivers for works; great when you work in an open plan environment. Battery life Usually lasts me a week of continuous use during work hours. Cons EQ is controlled via the app; much rather have had more functionality via the headphones; but to be honest they do the job as is.
customer_reviews.author: David R.

customer_reviews.title: The best just got better
customer_reviews.text: I had a pair of the Sony M2 headphones and was very happy with the sound quality, noise cancelling and comfort of those. These M3 headphones are even better. They're not just a tweak of the M2, they're a genuine step forward. I've used them on several long haul flights and they're fantastic, especially when you're wanting to get some rest and want to shut out the sounds of the plane and fellow passengers. My only minor gripe is the shortness of the headphone charge cable which makes plugging it into a travel adapter plugged into a wall socket a bit of a challenge. Overall though, I'm well chuffed with these M3 headphones!
customer_reviews.author: Lombardo

customer_reviews.title: A lot of money for a good sound
customer_reviews.text: Good sound but to be honest I have not really tested this unit out yet. Will get back to this at a later date. One thing which I know will annoy me these cans are over ear they can get very warm and sweaty if left on for long. There are no replacement ment parts cups etc for wear and tear for such expensive cans why not ? Very poor to my mind. Buy a set of bose headphones good sound with replacement parts. I will leave now and come back at a later date to give a full sp on sound and quality Hope this helps
customer_reviews.author: Terry

customer_reviews.title: The best that money can buy.
customer_reviews.text: I haven't put these headphones down since the first day I received them. Put simply, these headphones are the best that money can buy. I have used them for my commute, my music listening, my podcasts and for a recent 9 hour flight. Sound quality is superb and I only have to charge them once a week. The active noise cancelling is downright spooky. The option to cover your right ear cup to have a conversation works like a dream. I doubt that these headphones can be improved upon for a very long time so for me, this has been a solid investment.
customer_reviews.author: NIGEL

customer_reviews.title: Better for listening to Bob Marley than Led Zeppelin
customer_reviews.text: The Sony WH-1000XM3 is a best buy per Which?, What Hi-Fi and TechRadar. Which? says "The Sony WH-1000XM3 headphones are the very best wireless pair we've ever reviewed". What Hi-Fi says "These wireless and noise-cancelling Sonys set a new standard". TechRadar says "The Sony WH-1000XM3 are our best headphones of 2020". A review in YouTube says it has too much bass, and "muddy" sound. There is some truth in this. I enjoyed listening to Bob Marley on this but I prefer the Sony WF-1000XM3 (in ear) for listening to Led Zeppelin.
customer_reviews.author: mohan

customer_reviews.title: Great but...
customer_reviews.text: They look wonderful and feel amazing. The sound? Beautiful! Problems? -I was looking for powerful a bass and this was underwhelming. -I wish it had volume control buttons for you to make it even louder. The fact that it relies only on the volume given by your computer/phone, instead of having an independent volume control disappointed me. -The sliding up and down for volume control is frustrating at most. I am going to keep them, though. These were too expensive and I can forgive the lacklustre bass because they do feel and sound really great. But I am definitely buying different headphones when I get the chance.
customer_reviews.author: ECartagena

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous Headphones
customer_reviews.text: I wanted noise-cancelling headphones as am about to go on a long haul flight and couldn't bear the idea of the normal 'plane and people' noise. Did a lot of research. Tried on all the top brands. These win on all levels. They are extremely comfortable and fit me perfectly. The features are great and the noise cancelling is awesome (I've been using it on the tube and it make life so much better).
customer_reviews.author: Bambi Montgomery

customer_reviews.title: I really don't understand the hype about the headphones
customer_reviews.text: I had returned Sony WH-1000XM3 as found the noise cancelling function not being very good. The sound quality was average, also I could feel my ears getting sweaty and staying that way which I found uncomfortable. I have decided to get Bowers & Wilkings PX7 and loving my new headphones! They are way superior to Sony WH-1000XM3. The sound is amazing, they are very comfortable to wear (if it weren't for the music, I could forget I have them on my head!), and the noise cancelling function is so good. I cannot hear anything but music.
customer_reviews.author: Monika M

customer_reviews.title: Not Really HiFi
customer_reviews.text: These are excellent for noise cancellation on any transport, trains, planes, cars, buses etc. They can improve a journey no end. But I would never use them for listening at home. For instance, the Grado Labs SR80 at £84 are a far more pleasurable listen (admittedly neither bluetooth nor noise cancelling). This is of course because I'm judging an open back headset, with it's infinite airiness and the clarity of it's spectrum wide response, against the more muted and constipated sounds eminating from closed back headphones. Buy these for travel, but not for home use - unless of course the cacophony from children/teenagers/neighbours/over head aircraft/ nearbye motorways etc is too much to bear.
customer_reviews.author: RJfilm

customer_reviews.title: Quality headphones...my son wears them 24/7.
customer_reviews.text: My son has these headphones on his ears 24/7..... hes very happy with these headphones so obviously getting my moneys worth... i thought omg they were expensive!!!!! ...but of course buying these my son has QUALITY....cheap headphones damage your hearing....these of course are not damaging my sons heating as like i have already said he wears them 24/7 ....there is also many functions on these geadphones that are not available on others...if you need a good quality set of headphones then buy these...you wont regret it ...i am sure my son will get many tears of enjoyment from these....so would you if you huy them ..thank you seller..
customer_reviews.author: tasmicat

customer_reviews.title: Originally delighted but these stopped working after 4 months.
customer_reviews.text: Almost every time I use these headphones I have to delete them from Bluetooth and re-install. The volume control and the other controls on the right side of the headphones has stopped working. Sony support has been non-existent they said the software needed to be updated and they would email me a link. Despite several calls the email never arrived. It sounded absurd anyway. Don't rely on the name and don't buy these headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Gonzo Goose

customer_reviews.title: Great headphones just one problem....multiple devices
customer_reviews.text: I got these headphones to use while watching films on my iPad, listening to Audible on my iPhone and listening to music on my PC. They're brilliant. The noise cancelling feature is superb, the package is really slick, everything is great, just one problem though, if you want to switch between bluetooth devices there is no easy intuitive way to do so. You have to physically switch off one device in order to force the headphones or use a workaround. It would be great if Sony could introduce a way of doing this via a software update or maybe for the next generation of headphones (a button or a swipe function to cycle through different devices).
customer_reviews.author: V.S.

customer_reviews.title: Great but not enough to replace my WH-1000XM2
customer_reviews.text: Love them, but compared to my WH-1000XM2, I only love them as much as I love my older model. The difference is nowhere near as noticeable as the product description made me believe it was. The one thing I did notice most was that this model has more padding on the top compared to the previous model. Don’t get me wrong, they are great and you should definitely get them if they’re your first pair; but they’re not significantly better than the previous model.
customer_reviews.author: Eddie Y.

customer_reviews.title: Just buy them!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely amazing headphones, NC is superb tried it on many long haul flights and it has worked every time flawlessly. I compared them side by side with Bose qc35 II Andy tu Jose were flat in comparison. They are very confortable and sit lovely on the ears. The sound signature is everything you want it you are in to hip hop and rnb v shape with a brilliant bass and solid treble. The vocals are also nice and clear. Overall really impressive headphones with great sound.
customer_reviews.author: Slimbo8119

customer_reviews.title: Truly amazing sound
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely awesome set of headphones. I used to use my studio headphones to listen to music, and they were supposed to be noise cancelling but I was actually shocked how much the Sony blocked out sounds of the outside world. Fell into a deep trance listening to pink Floyd on the plane and actually forgot I was 35000 feet high. Volume control is annoying sometimes but I usually just keep it on full and control via phone or music device.
customer_reviews.author: William mcgoldrick

customer_reviews.title: Can cause ear ache!!!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love these ear phones, I really do. I spent lots of time researching them and invested as a lockdown present to myself. HOWEVER!!!! I listened to an audiobook as I was working outside (for about 8 hours) and that night my ears felt painful (felt a pulsing sensation in both ears at the same time). As the night wore on the pain increased so much so that it's 5.23 and I'm in agony. I googled this situation and some users complain of this problem after long term use. I'm not risking my hearing so sending back... great for short term use though.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Riggall

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product and performance!
customer_reviews.text: The headphones are well built, & comfortable when worn for extended periods. The noise cancellation is one of the best in the industry, and the additional compensation for atmospheric pressure through the app allows for an enhancement experience. Audio clarity is extremely good, with balanced highs, mid ranges and low frequency response. The app additionally allows settings for different situational effects, like concert hall, etc., plus a wide range of equalisation options. C port charging is a boon..10 minutes of charge allows for a few hours of usage time, which is possibly the best in the industry yet. The headphones are a bit on the pricier side, but in my opinion, well worth the price you pay!
customer_reviews.author: Kekoo Vacha

customer_reviews.title: White noise when sound cancellation engaged
customer_reviews.text: These headphones sound great when noise cancellation isn't engaged but once it is I get a faint white noise sound which is really annoying especially when listening to quieter pieces of music. Furthermore the left headphone developed a louder interference noise after a couple of days of use which was there even when it wasn't coupled to my phone. The headphones are nicely built but at this price I don't expect background white noise or any other interference so have returned these for a refund (Amazon customer service excellent as always). Also, the touch controls on the side of the headphones are a complete waste of time. They should use buttons and not an unresponsive and often flakey touch system.
customer_reviews.author: JofusPocus

customer_reviews.title: Unquestionably smart piece of kit.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these as a present, and only recently had a very short chance to try them personally. Short listen showed they are extremely comfortable, highest quality build, with very low sound leakage. Sound quality seemed very impressive, with good depth and good separation. Didn't have a chance to try any of the controls - and obviously no ability to check the extremely long battery life claimed.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Sluman

customer_reviews.title: A good product
customer_reviews.text: Weather they are value for money is a personal choice . But they are very comfortable . The sound is good , I wouldnt say exceptional . There is probably a reason much more expensive studio headphones are the price they are. These are good all -rounders . Controls for me work ok . Battery v good . App also ok . They connect well to some devices my less expensive headphones had trouble with . Have used mainly at home so haven't given a full test run but overall I'm glad I bought them . It's like you aren't blown away but at the same time your reluctant to take them off or use other headphones in the house.
customer_reviews.author: jack cartwright

customer_reviews.title: Speak up can't you...
customer_reviews.text: Went from Bose to these bad boys and what a difference! Lovely fit, excellent quality and several gears up in terms of noise reduction and sound quality. Battery life is superb and the app - often the achilles heel of any hardware - is solid and useful. Put them on and listen to the sound of silence...
customer_reviews.author: Paradoxically

customer_reviews.title: Failed after 24 Hours with Loud Wind-like Noise in Left Ear
customer_reviews.text: Product worked brilliantly for the first 24 hours then I started getting a very annoying sound in the left ear a bit like a strong wind blowing. This is definitely an issue with the active noise cancelling as whenever I turn that off, the sound goes away and I can still listen to my music. A look through the Sony support forums reveals that this is a very common issue. Sometimes blamed on a hardware failure and sometimes blamed on firmware. Either way, not something I will accept from a premium priced product such as this.
customer_reviews.author: Euan Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Awesome ANC, too much bass and muddy mids
customer_reviews.text: Amazing build quality. ANC is very impressive. Drowns traffic and even office noise quite well. Impressive. Sound quality is not great for £250. I have to be honest and say that I like my music flat (I'm a sound engineer after all) and was very disappointed with these. A lot of bass in the mix, and the bass-mids were really muddy. I guess it depends what genre of music you listen to. But if you like rock with British type guitars and gnarly mids these are not for you. I can imagine that for someone that listens to electronic styles with lots of sub bass this would be great but yeah, not for me. Returned them
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: still not able to pair
customer_reviews.text: Not pairing with anything. did work for a while, ambient noise switch made no difference. Won't pair with iphone no matter how many times I try. Update I have had it for a few months now and am very unimpressed. On skype its so muffled I cant hear my own voice, like I am underwater on all settings. I wish I had purchased some other brand. Useless if you want to hear your own voice on a call or skype, muffled to the extreme. Ambient on or off makes no audible difference, noise cancelling is good.
customer_reviews.author: christopher john stocker

customer_reviews.title: Best headphones ever
customer_reviews.text: Just mind blown by the headphones, I really can’t put them down, I love them so much! Noise canceling is impressive, sound quality is awesome, battery life is great given I use them ALL THE TIME basically all day long. Commands are really easy and it’s just a great headphone. Mic quality isn’t superb but it’s good enough that I can have long calls with friends while cooking and having my hands busy so i honestly don’t mind. I was skeptical of headphones so expensive but after trying it out for a month I’d say it was a great investment and they’re on my ears basically all the time I’m not asleep! Really recommend
customer_reviews.author: June

customer_reviews.title: Amazing quality!
customer_reviews.text: Moved from some Bludio to these and boy oh boy what a step change in sound quality and comfort. The sound is so good and the noise cancellation is so good that you are immersed into a whole new world of sound. Absolutely amazing. I can see why they're so expensive now, but it's worth it. Go on treat yourself and get them you really won't be disappointed with your purchase. The only thing is DON'T do the latest firmware update from Sony, because as many users have said it changes the noise cancellation for the worse, so leave them as they are until they remedy it. Just as I will.
customer_reviews.author: Uncle Fester

customer_reviews.title: Not new
customer_reviews.text: I’m sure these are great but at this price I like them to be new when they arrive. I received an obviously pre opened box with rough cable tied cables and bits of something in both earpieces. I know it’s unusual for amazon and not fair on Sony but it was also extremely unhygienic to send pre opened used headphones when sold as new
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Killer audio
customer_reviews.text: Ohhhh that's what it's supposed to sound like! I've only had these one day and want to listen to my entire music collection all over again. Been using in-ear headphones, from cheap to very expensive, for years but already I'd struggle to go back. Noise cancelling is superb, plane noise is gone, app is simple but includes great surround and EQ options, touch controls are super easy and the 'cup the earphone to temporarily cut sound so you can talk to people without removing the headset' function is brilliant. It's like I've finally procured the Sony Budukans of Massive Attack legend ;)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worth it!
customer_reviews.text: If you're working from home in a house with others or pets during this time, these will absolutely save your sanity! The noise cancellation works wonders for cutting out not only noises in the background and from other rooms, but also critcally for me PC fans and hard drives. The sound quality is also very good, no complaints at all for this class. They also use a type-c charger (huzzah!) and come with a very good travel case. They're not cheap, but very glad I picked these up.
customer_reviews.author: GloomyJD

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: These are by far the best headphones i have ever owned and i love the fact i can use noise cancelling mode on trains and hear nothing but my music, it really makes a difference from normal headphones and love the ability to press a button and bear the world around me so I don't even have to remove them when someone talks to me. I charged it for 5 mins and it would last me a couple hours which is great as sometimes need to rush out and don't have time to charge them but just 5 mins and i have nearly half a days worth of music
customer_reviews.author: Twistedcm

customer_reviews.title: Uncomfortable on ears and annoying to use touch controls
customer_reviews.text: Touches my ears when I wear them which causes my ears to hurt during medium-long periods. I don't have particularly large ears and when I checked online, a lot of people seem to be having this issue. The ear cups are very low-profile which looks great but at the cost of massive discomfort, it isnt worth it. I was really looking forward to these and the sound is great but I think I might have to switch back to Bose after-all =( PS: The volume control is annoying to use. Every swipe gives you 3% instead of a nice gradual increase on swipe like they have on Bose 700.
customer_reviews.author: Danish

customer_reviews.title: Excellent audio, amazing features, but...
customer_reviews.text: Bought it with lots of expectation due to various good reviews. Audio quality is impressive. The iPhone app features are really good. Gesture controls are amazing. Unfortunately, the one that I received had couple of issues, so had to return. It sometimes made me feel a bit dizzy. And there was frequent chimes during which the audio stops for a second. It was a bit annoying especially while you’re on a call. One more minor thing; it is supposed to come with an inflight adapter? that was missing!
customer_reviews.author: Bala

customer_reviews.title: Peace at last
customer_reviews.text: Picure the scene - an open plan office of approx 50 people. "Barry, ey Barry did ya go to the footie this weekend?" Bellows Steve three banks of desks away. "Hiya Steve, yeah it was..." 'heaphones on' .. .. .. Silence. I was going nuts with the level of incidental and unnecessary noise at work. Now I hardly hear it. If I put some music on, then I don't hear anything else - even something quiet like Aarvo Part is sufficient to remove Barry, Steve and the football from my world.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: Love these headphones. The noise cancelling is the best I have experienced and the sound quality is great. The headphones are very comfortable for extended use although your ears get warm this has never proved a problem. Bluetooth connection is quick and stable and range is very impressive. Battery life is amazing - even with heavy use these won’t need to be recharged very often. Lovely storage case allows the headphones to be folded flat for easy transportation. Looking forward to using these soon on a longhaul flight. Got these for a good discount in the Black Friday sale - the expected new model will have to be very good to match/beat these!
customer_reviews.author: Leginp

customer_reviews.title: Customer Complaint
customer_reviews.text: Received my headphones today. I have orderd WH-1000XMX previously along with WH-1000XM2. Looking to add a third set! I was surprised to see that the exterior packaging (box) had no plastic wrap as I have had this before. On opening the box I found that the headphones although appearing in reasonable / new condition had clearly been worn. There was ear wax residue on the inner parts of the phones. I am not happy with Amazon that this can occur!
customer_reviews.author: Flo

customer_reviews.title: Connecting the headphones auto raises volume and plays music - very annoying bug
customer_reviews.text: These are great except for one problem that arises every time I use it. Once the headphones connect to my phone, the phone volume jumps to an uncomfortably high level and the last media played starts autoplaying. Sometimes the volume autoincreases again once I've already turned it down. On a few occasions the headphones have shown as connected but audio still goes through the phone speakers. This means I have played very loud music to my office a few times by accident. No other Bluetooth headphones have had this effect, and I have looked at the settings on the headphones app but there doesn't appear to be anything doing.
customer_reviews.author: J. K. T. Pearson

customer_reviews.title: A hard choice between these and the Bose Q700's
customer_reviews.text: I was torn between these and the Bose Q700's. Overall the price point of the Sony's was approx £260, and the difference in price and the quality delivered sealed it for me. The noise cancellation is better than Bose in my opinion having tried both. The sound quality delivered is good to excellent. The bass is great, although the mids are a bit muddled sometimes. The touch controls work really well once you get dialled in to them. The only draw backs for me are the single bluetooth pairing, and the degradation in codec quality when using a custom noise shaping. The Bose are also excellent, but the features offered for this price are great.
customer_reviews.author: N Martin

customer_reviews.title: Great sound quality but poor microphone
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are light, comfy and provide amazing sound quality and noise cancellation. The only drawbacks that I've noticed are: 1- Microphone in phone calls, terrible quality. It amplifies the background noise making it really annoying to the person at the other end. I actually upgraded from the Sennheiser Momentum 2 to these thinking i'd get a better piece for phone calls. Even though, I'm still happy with this purchase. The noise cancellation and comfortableness these headphones offer really made me wanting to keep them. 2- You cannot to multiple bluetooth devices at the same time. To switch between devices you'll have to disconnect one before you can connect the other.
customer_reviews.author: husam

customer_reviews.title: Good but a few downsides
customer_reviews.text: Generally a good product. However when using these headphones on an aeroplane the sound cancellation did not muffle as much sound as I was hoping and I could still hear babies crying a few seat in front of me. The other problem is that the touch controls on the right ear up can sometimes be a bit unresponsive and can require multiple gestures for your intended action to take place. However they still have very good sound quality and are generally good headphones. Overall I would say they are good but not worth £270. More £200
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Great Fit
customer_reviews.text: I was a bit apprehensive when I ordered these headphones, as have a small head, and when I purchased my last set, the majority had large head pieces which did not fit me. I was very pleasantly surprised when I opened the box to find a lovely neatly packed pair of headphones that fitted perfectly. I am not very tech minded, so they are a bit over the head in technology for me, but I managed to pair them with my iPad, and they work great. The battery lasts a long time, and they are quick to charge. I am a happy bunny.
customer_reviews.author: Bev

customer_reviews.title: These don't live up to the hype
customer_reviews.text: These are okay headphones. But for the price I would expect much better. In my opinion the equaliser is absolutely essential to make these listenable. They are all bass otherwise. A bit like beats I think. I have much cheaper wired headphones that sound a lot better. The noise cancelling is quite good but gives me the sensation of pressure in my ears. And again I'm not completely blown away compared to other noise cancelling I've tried, but it is probably a bit better. I do really like the case they come on and they are comfortable. I think I'll be keeping them, but had hoped for better.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely mint.
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are simply brilliant, I had the V2s for a while and they were simply amazing too, but these V3s took it a step further especially with sound cancellation. However, if you're looking at value for the price, I'd say get the V2s especially on the current black friday sale and end up with an outstanding seat of headphones for half the price. The only "complaint" I have which is nit picking.. Is that I wish you could toggle the gesture controls on/off or lock them because, if you like to sit back with your arms behind your head.. you're going to toggle the quick attention mode.
customer_reviews.author: Liam Neeson

customer_reviews.title: Great headphones
customer_reviews.text: Not when I bought these they were easily the best noise-cancelling headphones on the market (say all the online reviewers worth listening to) they may be superseded by new versions from other manufacturers but there still a great pair of headphones. The noise cancelling will generate blaster if they rub on clothes or and wind is Blaenau for the mics, and they're going to be no good for the gym or very hot weather because they keep it is pretty toasty. touch controls on the earpiece can sometimes be a bit temperamental but I haven't experienced the reported problems with it at 0 degrees.
customer_reviews.author: Oli W

customer_reviews.title: Superb
customer_reviews.text: Like: Noise cancelling works superbly. Being able to switch between sound modes (ambient, etc.) when you need to hear something in real world. Sound quality is simply sublime. Build quality. Comfort - very comfortable, never fatiguing. Even when my glasses are on my face, I can listen for long periods. Fast charging and battery life so far impressive.. To improve: The swipe function for volume and changing track can be easily muddled. Haven't got the hang of it yet. Conclusion: Early days, but providing they last for a while, they are a decent investment, increasing enjoyment of music.
customer_reviews.author: BradleyOwl

customer_reviews.title: They JUST WORK. Super comfy. Great sound. Great controls. Better than most ANC
customer_reviews.text: I had the NAD Viso HP70 but suffered a lot of weird issues (whining/whistling noise, dropouts, poor sound quality, uncomfortable headband). A friend rocks the Sony's and swears by them. I don't often write reviews, but these headphones are game changers. Finally a bluetooth headphone that has it all: Great ANC, great controls, super comfortable, and a great sound. I've worn them for hours in the last few days, and sometimes forget I am wearing them. The noise cancellation is almost up there with Bose QC35, but everything else is way better, so as trade offs go, there are almost none to make. These win.
customer_reviews.author: R B.

customer_reviews.title: Poor mic and build quality let down amazing ANC
customer_reviews.text: Amazing noise cancellation, sounds is decent albeit it slightly muddled with the hard hitting bass, touch controls work well and the comfort was fairly decent. Two issues resulted in 2 pair going back. First creaked, this is a common fault and very distracting. 2nd size was the mic, absolutely awful for phone calls.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. D

customer_reviews.title: Great sound quality. Ok noise cancelling. Annoying voice control.
customer_reviews.text: I had bose quietcomfort 25, and sound quality on this is noticeable better over whole range. Bose have balance moved to base, mid frequency is suffering. From another hand I prefer bose’s button controls. Sony’s touch pad is very annoying, and triggers itself all the time. Voice control is also pointless for me, and you cannot turn it off completely. It randomly triggers and calls my friends. I hate it. Noise cancelling is not as good as Bose, however it doesn’t make a vacuum effect. It’s good enough for me. Overall headphones are really good, I would probably buy a previous model without voice control.
customer_reviews.author: mrded

customer_reviews.title: Incredible Noise Cancellation
customer_reviews.text: I used the beats 3 studio for the last 2 years and i decide to make the change to this and i am impressed so far. Sound quality is incredible really and i wasn't waiting so big difference with the beats but the sound volume its exactly the same. Now lets go to technology, the Sony application is actual smart and offers a perfect noise cancellation according to beats. The battery life is at the same levels more or less 30hours. Although, i use them with macbbook pro also with audio jack, they are doing great job also there.
customer_reviews.author: Evangelos Kalpakis

customer_reviews.title: Microphone doesn't work on phone calls or voice recorder.
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are excellent unless you want to use them for phone calls using mobile Android. They just do not work. Your voice cannot be heard by the person you are calling. Also voice recorder doesn't work either. Very poor quality for voice pick up and seems to be a common problem with other buyers. No solution provided by Sony as of yet. Kept these as the sound and high volume won over the Bose QC 35s although they did work for voice calls.
customer_reviews.author: J. Mackenzie

customer_reviews.title: Not so much of noise cancellation as I was expecting
customer_reviews.text: I bought this headphones mainly to mute all the noises in my house but found it didn't do a big difference - I could still hear everything, just slightly less - the same as if I'd have put some ear plugs (that cost for 10p)... The sound quality is about the same as the tiny Apple Airpods I have and I find them much more comfortable to wear than these big headphones. The gestures didn't quite work - it was just annoying that you expect them to do one thing but they do something different. Sorry have to return
customer_reviews.author: Nadia

customer_reviews.title: The Best Noise Cancellation Headphones
customer_reviews.text: I have the Bose, an I can confirm that it has far superior noise Cancellation, I have tested it outdoor s without music an its absolutely fantastic how the noise Cancellation does what it does with the QN1 chip. The sound quality is fantastic also playing hi res files wired is superb even using wifi with LDAC is wonderful, they are worth every penny, you'll have no regrets purchasing these head phones an I am a audiophile, buy them .
customer_reviews.author: The Specialist

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to replace my previous wired Bose n/c headphones which were getting to be a nuisance with too many cables & adapters required for iPhones with Lightning cables and an iPad with only USB-C. It's also useful not to have to carry one or two spare AAA batteries too. The noise cancellation on these Sonys is fantastic & I find them very comfortable to wear over glasses too, the gestures to change volume / pause / skip tracks are more useful than expected too - very pleased with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: hirsty

customer_reviews.title: Good headphones BUT
customer_reviews.text: These are expensive but the quality feels good, great sound easy to use, my only niggle is the accessories in the case are loose in a pocket and easily fall out, would have been better with velcro or zip patch. UPDATE I have used these for a few months ago. BIGGEST let down is the padding in the phones soon collapses and they become extremely uncomfortable. I would not recommend them on this basis. Very poor for the cost of the headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Its a 10 from Len

customer_reviews.title: They work just great
customer_reviews.text: I am not knowledgeable about music and earphones, brought these on a recommendation from my brother, but I find them excellent. The sound quality is fantastic and the features work very well, I am particularly pleased with the phone as calls are easy to answer and voice is excellent in both directions. I was unsure if I had made the right decision when I purchased them because they are not cheap but they have proved worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: 123.zeberdee

customer_reviews.title: Now with Alexa to challenge one of the USPs that Bose once boasted
customer_reviews.text: These are a great pair of headphones, and my first ‘serious’ pair. I trawled the web for advice on the best songs to listen to in order to test out new headphones and I tried a range of music and sonic ‘challenges’. I wasn’t disappointed. The recent software update to incorporate Alexa was the icing on the cake. I went for these over the Bose version. I can’t compare the models since I haven’t tried Bose, but Alexa integration was something that I initially acccepted as a feature I would not get with Sony. Now it’s integrated, I’m very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Craig-oh.

product_meta.title: Sony WH-1000XM3 Noise Cancelling Wireless Headphones with Mic, 30 Hours Battery Life, Quick Charge, Gesture Control, Ambient Sound Mode, with Alexa Built-in – Black
product_meta.description:
Introducing the Sony WH-1000XM3 premium wireless noise cancelling Bluetooth headphones, packed with intelligent technology and clever design to give you the ultimate listening experience on-the-go.



Sony's pioneering noise-cancelling technology* is taken to the next level in the WH 1000XM3 with the introduction of the QN1 processor. This processor boosts the range of frequencies from which noise-cancellation occurs, giving you greater control over the sounds you block out you want to while listening to your music. It's never been easier to completely immerse yourself in sound, taking the bustle out of travel and commuting.



The battery life of the 1000XM3 is an incredible 30 hours, so you don't need to worry about constantly charging your headphones and can head out on long journeys with confidence of battery not running out. If you do run low on battery, the improved quick charge functionality gives you 5 hours of playback time from just 10 minutes charging - so even if you do run out, you'll have your headphones back up and running in no time.



An improved lightweight design features deeper and softer ear pads, making the 1000X MK3 headphones even more comfortable. They also feature a skinnier and softer headband for a more ergonomic fit, with a noticeable improvement on the WH-1000XM2. They’re portable, flexible and foldable so easy to store and easy to adjust for your perfect fit too – they also come with a specifically designed carry case for easy and safe storage.



Hear music that stays true to the original recording with High-Resolution Audio, thanks to the QN1 processor's 32-bit audio signal processing. These headphones include a powerful 40mm driver with Liquid Crystal Polymer (LCP) diaphragm for handling heavy beats and can reproduce a full range of frequencies up to 40kHz. Even if you don't have high-resolution music, DSEE HX intelligently upscales compressed music files giving your music a clear, rich sound. LDAC transmits approximately three times more data than conventional Bluetooth, which enable the High-Resolution Audio content wirelessly. The 1000XM3 on-ear headphones are packed with technology to get the most out of your music.



The WH-1000XM3 also comes with a high res audio cable to provide an incredible a wired listening experience.



Smart settings by Adaptive Sound Control optimize listening settings automatically based on your listening behaviour and environment, but also allows you customisable control based on your own preferences. You can use the equalizer from the Headphone Connect App (works with Android and iOS) to easily set music levels to your personal taste. By placing your hand on the headphone housing, you can quickly communicate without having to take your headphones off or adjust the volume too, and a quick double-tap enables hands-free calling.



Combine high-quality sound with the simplicity of voice control. The WH-1000XM3 hasdual voice assistant compatibility: it is optimised for boththe Google AssistantandAmazon Alexa**. Play music, hear the news, control smart home devices, get answers to questions, and more just by talking to your headphones.

*As of August 30th 2018. According to research by Sony Corporation, measured using JEITA-compliant guidelines. In headband style of wireless noise cancelling headphones market. 

**May depend on software update.

feature_bullets: Industry leading noise cancellation* thanks to QN1 chip. Diaphragm: Aluminium-coated LCP. (Disclaimer in description)
Battery life of 30 hours and quick charging so you're never without your headphones
Improved design to make the 1000 x m3's even more comfortable and lightweight
High resolution audio packed with technology and features to give truly authentic sound
Optimized for google assistant and alexa for a seamless hands-free control and more
Alexa built-in devices let you instantly connect to Alexa to play music, control your smart home, get information, news, weather, and more using just your voice.
